Class ConsoleHandler

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.logging.ConsoleHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
LogHandler
public final class ConsoleHandler extends Object implements LogHandler
The ConsoleHandler class is an implementation of the LogEntryHandler interface. It handles log entries by writing them to the console.

  • Constructor Summary

    use ConsoleHandler(String, PrintStream, boolean) instead

    Constructs a ConsoleHandler with the specified PrintStream and colored flag.

  • Constructor Details

    • ConsoleHandler

      public ConsoleHandler(String name, PrintStream out, boolean colored)
      Constructs a ConsoleHandler with the specified PrintStream and colored flag.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the handler
      out - the PrintStream to which log messages will be written
      colored - flag indicating whether to use colored brackets for different log levels

    • ConsoleHandler

      @Deprecated(forRemoval=true) public ConsoleHandler(PrintStream out, boolean colored)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      use ConsoleHandler(String, PrintStream, boolean) instead
      Constructs a ConsoleHandler with the specified PrintStream and colored flag.
      Parameters:
      out - the PrintStream to which log messages will be written
      colored - flag indicating whether to use colored brackets for different log levels

      public PrintStream getPrintStream()

    • handle

      public void handle(Instant instant, String loggerName, LogLevel lvl, String mrk, Supplier<String> msg, String location, @Nullable Throwable t)
      Description copied from interface: LogHandler
      Handles a log entry.
      Specified by:
      handle in interface LogHandler
      Parameters:
      instant - the timestamp of the log entry
      loggerName - the name of the logger
      lvl - the log level of the log entry
      mrk - the marker associated with the log entry, or null if none
      msg - the message of the log entry
      location - the location in the code where the log entry was created
      t - the throwable associated with the log entry, or null if none

    • setColored

      public void setColored(boolean colored)
      Enable/Disable colored output using ANSI codes.
      Parameters:
      colored - true, if output use colors

    • isColored

      public boolean isColored()
      Check if colored output is enabled.
      Returns:
      true, if colored output is enabled

    • setFilter

      public void setFilter(LogFilter filter)
      Sets the filter for log entries.
      Specified by:
      setFilter in interface LogHandler
      Parameters:
      filter - the LogFilter to be set as the filter for log entries

    • getFilter

      public LogFilter getFilter()
      Retrieves the filter for log entries.

      This method returns the current filter that is being used to determine if a log entry should be included or excluded.

      Specified by:
      getFilter in interface LogHandler
      Returns:
      the LogFilter that is currently set as the filter for log entries.
